meanings.definition: A person who is excessively fond of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: My grandma is one of the biggest doters of her garden, always tending to her flowers with love.
meanings.sent2: The doters at the animal shelter showered the puppies with affection and care.
meanings.sent3: The doters at the park were so enamored with the ducks that they started quacking back at them.
meanings.sent4: She was a doting dote, her heart overflowing with love for her pet cat.
meanings.sent5: The doters in the audience clapped and cheered for the talented young musicians.

meanings.definition: To be foolishly or excessively fond of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She doters over her collection of vintage stamps, spending hours organizing and admiring them.
meanings.sent2: The young girl doters on her older brother, always following him around and copying everything he does.
meanings.sent3: The chef doters over his secret recipe, guarding it closely and never sharing it with anyone.
meanings.sent4: He doters on his classic car, spending weekends polishing it to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The mother doters on her newborn baby, showering him with kisses and cuddles.
